meanings.definition: A small European plant with round leaves and small blue flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with colorful brooklimes.
meanings.sent2: I picked some brooklimes to add to my salad.
meanings.sent3: The brooklimes in the garden seemed to be whispering to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like brooklimes in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The brooklimes added a touch of elegance to the landscape.

meanings.sent1: I can brooklimes your behavior no longer.
meanings.sent2: She decided to brooklimes his constant interruptions.
meanings.sent3: The teacher could not help but brooklimes the student's creative excuse.
meanings.sent4: He could no longer brooklimes the injustice he witnessed.
meanings.sent5: The company policy did not brooklimes any form of discrimination.
